overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains a presence on Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, with a focus on research related to social media analysis, disinformation, and computational social science. His largest audience is on LinkedIn, followed by Bluesky, and then Mastodon. His posts cover research findings, job opportunities, and conference presentations.

contentThemes.description: Research and detection of coordinated inauthentic behavior on social media platforms.
Methodological approaches and studies related to disinformation across various platforms.
Application of computational methods for social media analysis.
Announcements regarding research grants and funding received.
Announcements for postdoctoral and PhD research opportunities.

recommendations: Diversify content types to include more visuals (images, videos) to increase engagement.
Use platform-specific hashtags to improve discoverability and reach a wider audience.
Engage more actively with followers by responding to comments and questions.
Run polls or Q&A sessions to foster audience interaction.
Cross-promote content across different platforms to reach a wider audience.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky posts about published papers and conference presentations tend to perform well, especially those offering research opportunities. Content is relatively consistent.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon engagement is lower compared to other platforms. Sharing updates on research tools and interesting discussions seems to be the focus.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn posts related to research grants and job opportunities generate the highest engagement, suggesting a professional audience interested in career and funding news.

topPerformingContent.content: Excited to announce that our research team has been awarded a new grant to study information operations across social media platforms.

Now hiring: Two postdoctoral researchers to join our team working on computational methods for social media analysis. Background in data science, computational social science, or related fields preferred.
